rules.natural: If the platform has the multiplayer feature, then the game requires server capacity as a resource.
Whenever the platform announces a tournament as an event, it achieves the goal of user satisfaction.

rules.prover9_expression: (detects_anomaly(monitoring_system, traffic_spike) -> (-(requires_resource(game, server_capacity) -> has_performance(game, optimal)) -> triggers_alert(system, performance_degradation)))
rules.natural: If the monitoring system detects a traffic spike anomaly, then in the case where it is not true that if the game requires server capacity as a resource then the game has optimal performance, the system triggers an alert for performance degradation.
Either the monitoring system detects a traffic spike anomaly or it detects a hardware failure anomaly.

rules.prover9_expression: (detects_anomaly(monitoring_system, hardware_failure) -> (-(requires_resource(game, server_capacity) -> has_performance(game, optimal)) -> triggers_alert(system, performance_degradation)))
rules.natural: In the event that the monitoring system detects a hardware failure anomaly, then should it not be the case that if the game requires server capacity as a resource then the game has optimal performance, the system triggers an alert for performance degradation.
If the admin performs emergency maintenance, then the platform experiences a scheduled outage.
Either the admin ignores the safety protocol or if the admin authorizes maintenance as an action then the admin performs emergency maintenance.
Provided that the game has optimal performance, the platform achieves the goal of user satisfaction.
Should the developer use analytics software as a tool, then the admin monitors the server load of the system.
The developer uses analytics software as a tool or the developer uses a debugging tool as a tool.
Whenever the developer uses a debugging tool as a tool, then if the game requires server capacity as a resource, the game has optimal performance.

Either the developer publishes a patch as an update or if the admin monitors the server load of the system then whenever the game requires server capacity as a resource, the game has optimal performance.
If the developer releases an expansion as content, then the admin authorizes maintenance as an action.
The developer releases an expansion as content or the platform announces a tournament as an event.
If it is not true that whenever the game requires server capacity as a resource then the game has optimal performance, then the system does not trigger an alert for performance degradation.
In the case where it is not the case that if the developer releases an expansion as content then the platform experiences a scheduled outage, the user violates the terms of service by cheating.
